alert.note: Alert for Ogle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 30 at 8:06PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following counties, Lee and Ogle. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 754 PM CST, Ice spotters reported an ice jam on the Rock River near Lowell Park. Minor flooding is occurring upstream of this jam near the White Oaks Subdivision west of Grand Detour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... areas along the Rock River upstream of Lowell Park, including areas in and near Grand Detour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
